content: Write a sonnet about stars using only words that start with 't'.

Twinkling treasures trembling in the twilight,
Tender titans, timeless, touching the sky.
Transcendent, they trace trails, trajectories tight,
Telling tales of the universe's why.

Their twinkling tapestries tether thought,
To the mysteries that mankind has sought.
Through telescopes, we track their tiny dots,
Unveiling truths that time has not forgot.

They toil, though tranquil, in their timeless toils,
Throwing shadows, tracing celestial soils.
Their twinkle tells of travels, trials, and tolls,

In the theater of the night, they toll,
The tale of the cosmos, old and cold.
